intro: Pycreus globosus, commonly known as the globe lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its leaf-like thallus that is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga or cyanobacterium. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found on tree bark or rocks. Its structure and composition make it an important indicator species for environmental conditions.
